title: Manager, Compliance Operations
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
What you’ll do
The Risk Operations team is looking for an experienced risk professional to join an industry leading global operations team to spearhead our Partner Compliance & Systems Operations team. This person will develop, manage and execute on high impact initiatives with regard to financial partner risk programs.
The Risk team plays a critical role in ensuring a healthy financial eco-system for businesses around the world. We are looking to hire an experienced risk professional who is passionate about managing people, the payments ecosystem, educating others in complex areas of risk and is comfortable working to meet deadlines for Financial Partners. The right candidate for this role will have a minimum of 5+ years experience in risk management within e-commerce or payments and possess a deep understanding of the payments ecosystem, compliance and security programs, and have demonstrated financial partner management experience.
Responsibilities

Manage a team that drives long-term, strategic initiatives and projects that involve our acquiring and card network partners.
Develop a team of analysts and their strategic projects to minimize portfolio risk due to compliance reasons.
Work with merchants, from successful venture-backed startups to well established institutions; evaluating their business model risk and compliance risk drivers.
Help manage Stripes portfolio by developing a deep understanding of compliance risk across industries, geographies, and operating models;
Manage multiple projects to enhance and optimize operational strategy systems and tools;
Partner with multiple stakeholders and cross functional teams (Operations Leadership, Operations Managers, Product, Engineering, Partnerships, Support, Sales, etc) to prioritize and maximize the impact of your projects;
Leverage an analytical mindset. Collect data, user feedback, and market research and use that to improve processes.

Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

At least 5+ years of operations experience within Risk or Compliance 
Experienced people leader/manager combined with managing partnerships with global card networks or equivalent strategic, complex key partners
Experience managing programs that involve reporting and driving action at scale
Expertise in Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI/DSS) and Cardholder Data management
A proven track record of working effectively in a product-centric environment with significant internal and external dependencies
Deep understanding of card networks and payments ecosystem risk
Experience partnering with external stakeholders specifically Financial Partners and Card Networks
The ability to prioritize and guide individuals through competing demands and complex problems
An operationally focused mindset, with an ability to see a project through to success using planning, metrics and effective communication
Proficiency with data analysis tools
Experience working in the payments industry or at a leading technology company

Preferred qualifications:

Comfortable working with large data sets and proficiency in SQL
Former PCI qualified security assessor (QSA)

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
